BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1: JOHN S AND JAMES L KNIGHT FOUNDATION

SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: AFRICAN-AMERICAN MALES:KNIGHT'S BLACK MALE ENGAGEMENT INITIATIVE ENVISIONS BLACK MEN AND BOYS LEADING IN SOLUTIONS, PARTICIPATING IN DECISION-MAKING AND FULLY ENGAGED IN ALL ISSUES AND OPPORTUNITIES AFFECTING THEIR COMMUNITIES. TO GET THERE, KNIGHT OPENS UP OPPORTUNITIES FOR EVERYONE TO GET INVOLVED. WE PARTNER WITH AND SUPPORT IDEAS FROM LEADING NATIONAL NETWORKS, LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL CITIZENS. THE INITIATIVE INCLUDES SUPPORT FOR ON-LINE ENGAGEMENT PLATFORMS, LOCAL EVENTS AND GRANTS TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC INITIATIVES.IN PHILADELPHIA AND DETROIT KNIGHT PILOTED A BLACK MALES ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGN CALLED BME (PRONOUNCED "BE ME"). BME DIRECTLY CHALLENGES NEGATIVE STEREOTYPES OF BLACK MALES BY ENGAGING THOUSANDS OF OTHERS IN THE REAL LIFE STORIES AND POSITIVE COMMUNITY ACTIONS LED BY THEM.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: KNIGHT NEWS CHALLENGE: IN SUPPORT OF ITS MISSION TO PROMOTE QUALITY JOURNALISM, ADVANCE MEDIA INNOVATION AND ENGAGE COMMUNITIES, THE FOUNDATION HAS ESTABLISHED THE KNIGHT NEWS CHALLENGE PROGRAM. FOUNDATION STAFF CONNECT NEWS CHALLENGE WINNERS WITH TECHNICAL, DESIGN AND BUSINESS ADVISORS, PROMOTES THEIR ACTIVITIES, AND CONVENES WITH ONE ANOTHER AND OTHER THOUGHT LEADERS. THE FOUNDATION CONDUCTED TWO NEWS CHALLENGES IN 2013, THE SECOND IN COLLABORATION WITH THE CALIFORNIA HEALTHCARE FOUNDATION, THE ROBERT WOOD JOHNSON FOUNDATION AND THE HEALTH DATA CONSORTIUM.HAVING ACCESS TO FACT-BASED QUALITY NEWS AND INFORMATION PLAYS A VITAL ROLE IN EDUCATING A COMMUNITY. INCREASINGLY, THIS INFORMATION IS DISCOVERED, ANALYZED AND DELIVERED USING DIGITAL OR WEB-BASED TOOLS. THE FOUNDATION USES THE NEWS CHALLENGE TO PROMOTE INNOVATIVE DIGITAL BASED SOLUTIONS TO IMPROVING RESIDENTS' ABILITY TO ACCESS AND INTERACT WITH NEWS, INFORMATION AND EACH OTHER SO THAT THEY CAN MAKE BETTER EDUCATED DECISIONS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: COMMUNITY INFORMATION INITIATIVE:THE COMMUNITY INFORMATION CHALLENGE ENGAGES COMMUNITY AND PLACE-BASED FOUNDATIONS IN PLAYING LEADING ROLES IN MEETING THE INFORMATION NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE CIC HAS THREE MAJOR COMPONENTS; A GRANT CONTEST WHICH INCLUDES ON-GOING TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR GRANTEES AND A MAJOR CONFERENCE BRINGING TOGETHER COMMUNITY AND PLACE-BASED FOUNDATION LEADERS WITH JOURNALISM AND TECHNOLOGY EXPERTS.THE KNIGHT COMMUNITY INFORMATION CHALLENGE PROVIDES GRANTS TO COMMUNITY AND PLACE-BASED FOUNDATIONS IN PLAYING LEADING ROLES IN MEETING THE INFORMATION NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE CONTEST ENCOURAGES FOUNDATIONS TO FIND CREATIVE WAYS TO FUND MEDIA PROJECTS THAT INFORM AND ENGAGE RESIDENTS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS: THE KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS WAS FORMED BY THE JOHN S. AND JAMES L. KNIGHT FOUNDATION IN OCTOBER 1989 IN RESPONSE TO MORE THAN A DECADE OF HIGHLY VISIBLE SCANDALS IN COLLEGE SPORTS. THE COMMISSION'S INITIAL GOAL WAS TO RECOMMEND A REFORM AGENDA THAT EMPHASIZED ACADEMIC VALUES IN AN ARENA WHERE COMMERCIALIZATION OF COLLEGE SPORTS OFTEN OVERSHADOWED THE UNDERLYING GOALS OF HIGHER EDUCATION. SINCE 1989, THE KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS HAS WORKED TO ENSURE THAT INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS PROGRAMS OPERATE WITHIN THE EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF THEIR COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES.(CONTINUED ON STATEMENT 22)

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: PRX, INC.: LIMITED PARTNERSHIP INTEREST TO INITIATE AND ADVISE INNOVATION IN PUBLIC MEDIA BY ESTABLISHING THE KNIGHT PRX PUBLIC MEDIA ACCELERATOR.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING ARE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION WEBSITE. PLEASE GO TO WWW.KNIGHTFOUNDATION.ORG TO APPLY FOR A GRANT. FOR JOURNALISM, COMMUNITIES, NATIONAL AND ARTS PROGRAMS, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN OUR ONLINE FORM: TELL US ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY PRESENTED BY YOUR IDEA/PROJECT, WHAT IT WILL TRANSFORM, AND THE IMPACT IT WILL HAVE. HOW WILL IT CREATE LASTING, VISIBLE CHANGE? TELL US HOW YOU INDENTIFIED THIS OPPORTUNITY AND WHY THE TIME IS RIGHT FOR IT. WHAT OTHER PARTNERS OR FUNDERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE IDEA/PROJECT? HOW WILL YOU MEASURE SUCCESS? HOW ARE YOU UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT? PLEASE DESCRIBE ORGANIZATIONAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT INCLUDING ANY BUSINESS PLAN. HOW WILL YOUR IDEA/PROJECT BE SUSTAINED BEYOND KNIGHT FOUNDATION'S FUNDING?
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.SubmissionDeadlinesTxt: WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SPECIAL INITIATIVES AND CONTESTS, THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE DEADLINES.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: ANY RESTRICTIONS OR LIMITATIONS ON AWARDS, SUCH AS BY GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS, CHARITABLE FIELDS, KIND OF INSTITUTIONS OR OTHER FACTORS: -MEDICAL RESEARCH, ORGANIZATIONS OR PROJECTS WHOSE MISSION IS TO PREVENT, ERADICATE AND/OR ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF A SPECIFIC DISEASE -POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS AND LEGISLATIVE LOBBYING EFFORTS -PROJECTS THAT EXCLUSIVELY SERVE RELIGIOUS PURPOSES -DIRECT SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS

GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: (CONTINUED FROM STATEMENT 20)IN JUNE 2010 THE KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS PUBLISHED ITS THIRD MAJOR REPORT, RESTORING THE BALANCE: DOLLARS, VALUES AND THE FUTURE OF COLLEGE ATHLETICS. FOLLOWING A PUBLIC NEWS CONFERENCE LED BY COMMISSION MEMBERS OUTLINING THE REPORT'S RECOMMENDATIONS, COPIES OF THE REPORT WERE DISTRIBUTED TO COLLEGE PRESIDENTS, FACULTY, MEDIA, ADMINISTRATORS, HIGHER EDUCATION LEADERS, SCHOLARS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. AN ONLINE MULTIMEDIA REPORT WAS PUBLISHED AS WELL. COMMISSION LEADERSHIP AND STAFF MADE PRESENTATIONS TO A NUMBER OF GROUPS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR PROMOTING THE PRIMARY RECOMMENDATIONS TO: 1) REQUIRE PUBLIC TRANSPARENCY OF EACH INSTITUTION'S NCAA FINANCIAL REPORT, 2) REWARD PRACTICES THAT MAKE ACADEMICS A PRIORITY IN ATHLETICS, AND 3) TREAT ATHLETES AS STUDENTS FIRST AND FOREMOST-NOT AS PROFESSIONALS. DURING THE YEAR, THE FULL COMMISSION MET ON TWO SEPARATE OCCASIONS. ONCE TO COMPLETE THE REPORT AND THEN AGAIN, FIVE MONTHS FOLLOWING ITS RELEASE, TO ACCESS THE REPORT'S IMPACT. THE REPORT'S RESEARCH AND RECOMMENDATIONS INFORMS HIGHER EDUCATION LEADERS, THE MEDIA AND THE PUBLIC ABOUT KEY POLICY ISSUES IN COLLEGE SPORTS. THE NCAA IS IMPLEMENTING ONE OF THE REPORT'S CENTRAL RECOMMENDATIONS-TO ESTABLISH AN ACADEMIC THRESHOLD FOR POSTSEASON ELIGIBILITY.

MARIAM NOLAND (TRUSTEE) IS THE PRESIDENT OF COMMUNITY FOUNDATION FOR SOUTHEASTERN MICHIGAN, WHICH OWNS A BUILDING IN WHICH THE KNIGHT FOUNDATION RENTS OFFICE SPACE. TOTAL PAYMENTS MADE IN 2013 WERE $8,304.

CERTAIN NEWSPAPERS THAT WERE ONCE OWNED BY KNIGHT RIDDER, INC., A DISQUALIFIED PERSON WITH REGARDS TO THE FOUNDATION, RAN ADVERTISEMENTS FOR THE JOHN S. AND JAMES L. KNIGHT FOUNDATION AT FAIR MARKET VALUE. THE COSTS OF THE ADVERTISEMENTS WERE ALSO INCLUDED IN "OTHER PUBLICATIONS".THE KNIGHT FOUNDATION ALSO PURCHASED ADVERTISING SERVICES FROM A SUBSTANTIAL CONTRIBUTOR AT FAIR MARKET VALUE.
SEE PART VIII FOR PAYMENTS TO TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS.
DURING THE YEAR, THE FOUNDATION MADE GRANTS OVER WHICH IT EXERCISES EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITIES. SEE STATEMENT 16 FOR A DESCRIPTION OF THESE GRANTS.

KNIGHT FOUNDATION MADE PAYMENTS OF $17.5 MILLION IN 2013 TO COMMUNITY FOUNDATION DONOR ADVISED FUNDS (DAFS) IN ALL 26 COMMUNITIES WHICH ARE TREATED AS QUALIFIED DISTRIBUTIONS. THE FOUNDATION IS THE DONOR ADVISOR FOR THESE DAFS. AS THE ADVISOR ON THE DAFS, KNIGHT MONITORS ALL DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE DAFS TO ENSURE THAT THEY SUPPORT KNIGHT'S CHARITABLE PURPOSE TO PROMOTE QUALITY JOURNALISM, ADVANCE MEDIA INNOVATION, ENGAGE COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER THE ARTS. SINCE 1998, THE FOUNDATION HAS MADE TOTAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF $120.2 MILLION, INCLUDING 2013, TO ITS DAF PROGRAMS.

A BELOW MARKET RATE LOAN TO HELP INDEPENDENT SECTOR, ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT NATIONAL SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS TO THE FIELD OF PHILANTHROPY AND NONPROFITS, TO RECAPITALIZE ITS OPERATIONS AND FOCUS ON ITS CORE MISSION.

FORM 990-PF, PART VIII- LIST OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND TRUSTEES:THE FULL TIME WORKWEEK HAS BEEN ALLOCATED 40 HOURS. THOSE LISTED ARE EXEMPT POSITIONS WHERE EMPLOYEES APPLY NECESSARY HOURS TO PERFORM THEIR JOB.THE TRUSTEES MEET FOUR TIMES A YEAR FOR TWO FULL DAYS OF BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEETINGS. TRUSTEES TYPICALLY DEVOTE A MINIMUM OF 8 FULL DAYS PER YEAR TO OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW OF THE FOUNDATION'S OPERATIONS PROGRAMS AND INVESTMENTS, THOUGH TYPICALLY MORE.
